meanings.definition: A long, flexible tube with a camera on the end used to examine the inside of the colon.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used a colonoscope to look inside the patient's colon.
meanings.sent2: During the procedure, the colonoscope was carefully inserted into the colon.
meanings.sent3: The colonoscope decided to take a peek inside the colon for a change of scenery.
meanings.sent4: The colonoscope was like a curious explorer venturing into the depths of the colon.
meanings.sent5: The colonoscope's camera revealed the inner workings of the colon in vivid detail.

meanings.definition: To examine the colon using a colonoscope.
meanings.sent1: The doctor will colonoscope the patient to check for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent2: It is important to colonoscope regularly for early detection of colon issues.
meanings.sent3: The colonoscope quickly colonoscoped the colon and found nothing out of the ordinary.
meanings.sent4: She decided to colonoscope her own colon to understand the process better.
meanings.sent5: Colonoscoping allows doctors to detect and treat colon problems effectively.
